item.title: 2025 Trips and Events
item.description:
A summary of weekend trips taken and events that we have attended during 2025, for memory keeping.

  • January: Bangalee & Shoalhaven Heads 3 days w/ B&W
  • March: National Multicultural Festival w/ B&W
  • Haig Park Village Markets, Sunday 8:00am to 2:00pm. Dogs are welcome. Dog agility training park next to it. w/ B&W
  • Corin Dam - National park, no dogs allowed. w/ B&W
  • Experience Breathing Space, an evocative sound installation created for the Garden of Australian Dreams at the National Museum of Australia. w/ B
  • Composed by renowned musician Genevieve Lacey, Breathing Space pays homage to the deep time and ecological abundance of our continent, the ancient, vibrant cultures of First Nations Australians and the waves of migration that have shaped the land.
  • Wander through the Garden and discover sounds and melodies that change subtly, hour by hour, day by day, season by season. Whenever and wherever you are in the Garden, you will hear something new.
  • May: RSPCA Million Paws Walk w/ B&GM
  • Halls market - very nice outing. Dogs are welcome. w/ B&W
  • Little Burley Market - a lovely place to walk with your dog and people. w/ B
  • June: Malua Bay for the long weekend w/ B&W
  • July: Sydney w/ JB

item.title: Road Trip WA
item.description:
24-25, March 2016, Easter. Another year and another Easter, time goes so fast. Three of us has decided to take a road trip to the Western Australia’s Southern Forest Region. We all knew the region pretty well so the trip was roughly planned and the accommodation was booked a few days before the trip.

The Itinerary

Day 1

  • Leave Perth

  • Rest at Bunbury (1.5hrs), change driver

  • Take the National Route 1 from Bunbury to Walpole, rest at Bridgetown and Manjimup

item.title: Road Trip and Walk Like a Londoner
item.description:
I took the train back to London. It was cold comparing with the barmy 22 degrees in Edinburgh a few hours ago. Nevertheless, I was so excited. Here I come, road trip to south England!

Love The Car

First thing first, I needed a car! It was booked a month ago with Avis. The Avis branch can be found inside the St Pancras Station car park. St Pancras Station is cross the road from the King’s Cross Station; one is international and the other is domestic. From the main departure information hall, follow the signals to the Car Park passing Boots, Patisserie Valerie and Pret A Manger. It took me a while to locate it because the office was small, shared with other rental companies (so do not just look for the Avis sign like I did) and it was at the entrance/exit of the car park.

item.title: Scotland!
item.description:
Edinburgh

I love Edinburgh!

The receptionist at the hotel told me that it would be quicker to go to the King’s Cross train station by the Tube than taxi. It took me 30min on the Tube from Gloucester Road to the King’s Cross train station, not difficult at all.

Not many people were at the Platform 9 3/4 so I had a photo taken in front of it. :) By 9am, there was a long queue of people waiting to take photo there and the station staff had to put signs around to keep things in order.
